item.title: Citadel 将非竞争期延长至 21 个月以留住人才
item.description: 肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel 公司将一些投资组合经理的竞业禁止协议延长至 21 个月，凸显出多策略对冲基金之间的招聘大战仍在持续。【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel prolonged its non-compete agreements for some portfolio managers to 21 months, underscoring the unrelenting hiring war among multistrategy hedge funds.】

item.title: 拜登阻止交易后，新日铁、美国钢铁公司提起诉讼
item.description: 新日本钢铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp.）和美国钢铁公司（United States Steel Corp.）联合提起诉讼，为维持上周被美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）阻止的两家公司合并计划做出最后努力。【原文：Nippon Steel Corp. and United States Steel Corp. jointly filed lawsuits in a last-ditch effort to preserve the planned merger of the companies, which was blocked last week by President Joe Biden.】

item.title: 特朗普阴影下的全球降息前景
item.description: 我是克雷格-斯特林（Craig Stirling），驻法兰克福的经济学编辑。今天我们将探讨 2025 年中央银行的发展之路。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Craig Stirling, an economics editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking at the path for central banks in 2025. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: CES 的价值远不止会场上的展品
item.description: 本周在拉斯维加斯举行的消费电子展（CES）上，虽然华丽的宴会厅展览可能会吸引公众的眼球，但真正的活动将在楼上的酒店套房里与交易商们展开。但首先...【原文：While the flashy ballroom exhibitions may draw the public attention this week at CES in Las Vegas, the real action will be upstairs in the hotel suites with the dealmakers. But first...】

item.title: 报道称特朗普将限制关税，美元创两个月来最大跌幅
item.description: 美元兑大多数主要货币汇率周一大幅下跌，原因是人们押注美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税计划不会像人们原先担心的那样广泛，也不会助长通胀。【原文：The US dollar fell sharply against most major currencies on Monday on bets that US President-elect Donald Trump’s tariff plans won’t be as broad and inflation-fanning as originally feared.】

item.title: 迪士尼即将达成将 Hulu + Live 合并为 Fubo 的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，华特迪士尼公司（Walt Disney Co.【原文：Walt Disney Co. and streaming provider FuboTV Inc., are nearing a deal to combine their online live TV businesses, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，布鲁克菲尔德的克拉里欧斯计划举债分红
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Clarios International Inc. 正在考虑举借新债，以便将现金交给其所有者，包括布鲁克菲尔德资产管理有限公司（Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. ）和加拿大养老基金魁北克储蓄与投资局（Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec）。【原文：Clarios International Inc. is considering taking on new debt in order to hand cash to its owners, including Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. and Canadian pension fund Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 拜登以国家安全为由否决钢铁交易
item.description: 乔-拜登总统决定阻止日本新日铁公司以 141 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的出价，这凸显出美国正从全球化向更广泛的国家安全定义转变。【原文：President Joe Biden’s decision to block Japanese-owned Nippon Steel’s $14.1 billion bid to acquire US Steel underscores the shift away from globalization and embrace of a broader definition of national security.】

item.title: 在新兴市场最强劲的反弹中，黎巴嫩债券进入决定成败的一周
item.description: 黎巴嫩正在进入其多年来寻求政治稳定的关键一周，一些债券持有人正在等待一个难得的积极消息。【原文：Lebanon is entering a crucial week in its years-long search for political stability — and some bondholders are positioning for a rare bit of positive news.】

item.title: 债券市场对特朗普和通胀感到不安
item.description: 进入新的一年，债券交易员们又开始担心通货膨胀和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的总统任期。较长期限的债券遭到大幅抛售，基准 10 年期国债收益率升至 4.6% 以上，比美联储 9 月开始放松货币政策时的水平高出约整整一个百分点。30 年期国债收益率今天突破了 4.85%。本周将有 1,190 亿美元的政府债务发行，人们越来越担心共和党人将在本周内通过 "贿赂 "或 "贿赂 "的方式来削减政府债务。【原文：Bond traders are entering the new year with fresh worries about inflation and the presidency of Donald Trump. Longer-dated bonds have been hit by a sharp selloff, with the yield on benchmark 10-year Treasuries rising to more than 4.6%, roughly a full percentage point above where it was when the Fed started easing monetary policy in September. The 30-year bond yield topped 4.85% today. There’s $119 billion of government debt issuance coming this week, and growing concern that Republicans will dri】

item.title: 初创公司推出智能摇篮，力压售价 1,700 美元的 Snoo 婴儿床
item.description: Elvie 是一家以生产高科技吸奶器而闻名的初创公司，它正在进军一个新的领域：旨在与流行的 Snoo 竞争的智能摇篮。【原文：Elvie, a startup best known for making high-tech breast pumps, is expanding into a new category: a smart bassinet designed to compete with the popular Snoo.】

item.title: 世界第一大钴矿生产商 2024 年产量创历史新高
item.description: 世界第一大钴矿商 2024 年的金属产量创下历史新高，这要归功于其在非洲的巨型矿山的快速扩张。【原文：The world’s No. 1 cobalt miner churned out a record volume of the metal in 2024, thanks to a speedy ramp-up of its giant mines in Africa.】

item.title: 拍卖焦虑导致英国借贷成本接近 1998 年以来最高水平
item.description: 随着交易商为本周的一系列债券销售做好准备，英国的长期借贷成本接近四分之一世纪以来的最高水平。【原文：UK long-term borrowing costs are nearing the highest levels in more than a quarter of a century as traders brace for a raft of bond sales this week.】

item.title: 萨科齐因与卡扎菲现金有关的犯罪阴谋受审
item.description: 法国前总统尼古拉-萨科齐（Nicolas Sarkozy）被指控在2007年竞选获胜时，利比亚已故领导人穆阿迈尔-卡扎菲（Moammar Qaddafi）的助手秘密为其提供了约500万欧元（约合520万美元）的现金和海外汇款，萨科齐因此成为审判的焦点人物。【原文：Ex-French President Nicolas Sarkozy is at the center of a trial over allegations his 2007 winning campaign was covertly funded by about €5 million ($5.2 million) in cash and offshore transfers paid by aides to Libya’s late leader, Moammar Qaddafi.】

item.title: 智利资本市场黑洞加深，立法者争吵不休
item.description: 随着有关智利养老金改革的争论一拖再拖......一拖再拖......智利资本市场中心的黑洞却越来越大，而它正是要填补这个黑洞。【原文：As the debate over Chile’s pension reform drags on... and on... and on... the black hole at the center of the country’s capitals market that it’s meant to fill is just getting bigger.】

item.title: 英伟达投资者期待黄仁勋在 CES 上的演讲引发下一次突破
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的投资者对该公司首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）周一的讲话寄予厚望，希望这将引发该芯片制造商股价的新一轮突破。【原文：Nvidia Corp. investors have high hopes that Monday’s speech from CEO Jensen Huang will spark a fresh breakout in the chipmaker’s shares, which have plateaued since November after roaring higher for much of 2024.】

item.title: 欧洲央行认为劳动力市场在科维德后繁荣时期已趋于正常化
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）称，随着大流行病后惊人繁荣的影响逐渐消散，欧元区就业市场将开始符合历史标准。【原文：The euro-zone jobs market will start conforming to historic norms as the effects of a startling post-pandemic boom dissipate, according to the European Central Bank.】

item.title: 统计网站遭黑客攻击数周后，尼日利亚数据仍无着落
item.description: 在尼日利亚统计机构因遭到黑客攻击而关闭网站近三周后，有关尼日利亚经济的关键数据仍无法访问。【原文：Key data on the Nigerian economy remains inaccessible, nearly three weeks after the nation’s statistics agency shut down its website after it had been hacked.】

item.title: 印度计划为电子产品提供约 30 亿美元援助并削减关税
item.description: 印度政府正在考虑为电子元件制造商提供新的补贴，并削减进口关税，以帮助促进本地制造业，尤其是苹果公司等公司生产的智能手机。【原文：India’s government is considering fresh subsidies for electronic component-makers and cutting tariffs on imports to help boost local manufacturing, especially of smartphones made by companies like Apple Inc.】

item.title: 南苏丹石油出口不可抗力在 10 个月后解除
item.description: 苏丹取消了 3 月份对南苏丹原油出口发出的不可抗力通知，这标志着在战区受损的输油管道恢复了石油运输。【原文：Sudan lifted a force majeure notice issued in March on crude exports from South Sudan, signaling resumption of oil shipments through a pipeline that had been damaged in a war zone.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利策略师威尔逊警告收益率飙升给股市带来风险
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）策略师表示，随着国债收益率飙升以及美元因通胀忧虑而走高，美国股市未来六个月可能面临严峻考验。【原文：US equities could face a tough six months ahead as Treasury yields surge and the dollar advances on worries about inflation, according to Morgan Stanley strategists.】

item.title: 拜登禁止在美国大西洋和太平洋地区进行海上石油钻探
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）无限期地阻止在美国沿海超过 6.25 亿英亩的水域进行海上石油和天然气开发，并警告说在那里钻井 "不值得冒风险"，而且 "没有必要 "满足美国的能源需求。【原文：President Joe Biden is indefinitely blocking offshore oil and gas development in more than 625 million acres of US coastal waters, warning that drilling there is simply “not worth the risks” and “unnecessary” to meet the nation’s energy needs.】

item.title: GoTo 再给首席执行官五年时间让汽车租赁公司实现盈利
item.description: GoTo 集团表示，Patrick Walujo 将继续管理公司约五年时间，让这位首席执行官有更多时间扭转印尼无利可图的打车和食品配送行业冠军的局面。【原文：GoTo Group said Patrick Walujo will run the company for about five more years, giving the chief executive officer more time to turn around Indonesia’s unprofitable ride-hailing and food-delivery champion.】

item.title: 英国采购经理人指数（PMI）显示：里夫斯预算案公布后，每四家英国公司中就有一家裁员
item.description: 由于对工党增税预算案对企业财务造成的挤压普遍感到悲观，几乎四分之一的英国企业在 12 月份裁员。【原文：Almost one in four British businesses cut jobs in December amid widespread pessimism over the squeeze on their finances from Labour’s tax-raising budget.】

item.title: 西北欧为冰雪天气做好准备，天然气库存将消耗殆尽
item.description: 本周欧洲西北部的冰冻天气将进一步对天然气库存造成压力，而该地区南部和东部则会出现反常的温暖天气。【原文：Freezing weather across northwest Europe this week will put further pressure on gas inventories, while the south and east of the region will be unseasonably warm.】

item.title: 日本烤箱制造商以 16 亿美元收购富士通将军公司
item.description: 日本一家名不见经传的烤箱和热水器制造商提出以高达 2,570 亿日元（16 亿美元）的价格收购富士通将军有限公司，成为富士通有限公司空调部门的最新收购者。【原文：A little-known Japanese maker of oven ranges and water heaters has offered to acquire Fujitsu General Ltd. for as much as ¥257 billion ($1.6 billion), becoming the latest suitor for Fujitsu Ltd.’s air-conditioner unit.】

item.title: 更简便的签证规则推动泰国旅游业接近前苏联时期水平
item.description: 泰国去年的外国游客人数猛增了 26%，因为这个依赖旅游业的国家放宽了入境规定，对中国人免签，而中国人是这个东南亚国家最大的游客群体。【原文：Thailand saw foreign tourist arrivals jump 26% last year after the tourism-reliant nation eased entry rules and waived visas for Chinese, the largest group of visitors to the Southeast Asian country.】

item.title: 每个人都充满希望、幸福和富有时的感觉
item.description:
让我们重温 90 年代。【原文：

Let's revisit the ‘90s.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：当每个人都充满希望、快乐和富有时（播客）
item.description: 如果你看一下各种调查，美国人对经济状况的感觉是严峻的。但即使在经济本身之外，你也会看到对美国各种机构的信心的负面解读。至少在社会层面上，悲观情绪现在似乎很盛行。但并非总是如此。20 世纪 90 年代，我们正处于冷战和反恐战争之间。在这十年的大部分时间里，股票市场蓬勃发展。乐观主义盛行。那么，当时的情况是怎样的，又是如何在20世纪80年代戛然而止的呢？【原文：If you look at various surveys, Americans feel grim about the state of the economy. But even outside of the economy itself, you see negative readings for faith in various American institutions. Pessimism seems to be in right now, at least on a societal level. But it wasn’t always this way. In the 1990s, we were between the Cold War and the War on Terror. The stock market boomed through much of the decade. Optimism was in. So what was that like, and then how did it come to an abrupt end in the ea】

item.title: 乌克兰天然气管道关闭后普京还有其他选择
item.description: 在基辅关闭了对俄罗斯天然气供应的天然气管道后，弗拉基米尔-普京可能失去了一部分收入，但莫斯科已经有了运输燃料的替代方案，可以避免任何严重的经济损失。【原文：Vladimir Putin might have lost a slice of revenue after Kyiv closed its gas pipeline to Russian supplies, but Moscow already has alternatives for shipping the fuel that stand to shield it from any serious economic hit.】
